content.text:
# 12th Costume Designers Guild Awards

| location      = The Beverly Hilton, Beverly Hills, California
| country       = United States
| presenter     = Costume Designers Guild
| host          = Parker Posey
| award1_type   = Excellence in Contemporary Film:
| award1_winner = Crazy Heart – Doug Hall
| award2_type   = Excellence in Fantasy Film:
| award2_winner = The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus – Monique Prudhomme
| award3_type   = Excellence in Period Film:
| award3_winner = The Young Victoria – Sandy Powell
| previous      = 11th
| main          = CDG Awards
| next          = 13th
}}
The 12th Costume Designers Guild Awards, honoring the best costume designs in film and television for 2009, were given on February 25, 2010. The nominees were announced on January 26, 2010.
Winners and nominees
The winners are in bold.
Film
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Excellence in Contemporary Film
!style="width=50%"|Excellence in Period Film
|-
| valign="top" |
*'Crazy Heart – Doug Hall'
**(500) Days of Summer – Hope Hanafin
**Brüno – Jason Alper
**Precious: Based on the Novel "Push" by Sapphire – Marina Draghici
**Up in the Air – Danny Glicker
| valign="top" |
*'The Young Victoria – Sandy Powell'
**Coco Before Chanel – Catherine Leterrier
**Julie & Julia – Ann Roth
**Nine – Colleen Atwood
**Sherlock Holmes – Jenny Beavan
|-
!style="width=50%" colspan="2"|Excellence in Fantasy Film
|-
|valign="top" colspan="2"|
*'The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus – Monique Prudhomme'
**Avatar – Mayes C. Rubeo and Deborah Lynn Scott
**Star Trek – Michael Kaplan
|}
Television
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Contemporary Television
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Period/Fantasy Television
|-
| valign="top"|
*'Glee – Lou Eyrich'
**Big Love – Chrisi Karvonides-Dushenko
**Dancing with the Stars – Randall Christensen
**''The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency – Jo Katsaras
**Ugly Betty – Patricia Field
| valign="top"|
*'Mad Men – Janie Bryant'
**True Blood – Audrey Fisher
**The Tudors – Joan Bergin
|-
!style="width=50%" colspan="2"|Outstanding Made for Television Movie or Miniseries
|-
|valign="top" colspan="2"|
*'Grey Gardens – Catherine Marie Thomas'
**Georgia O'Keeffe – Michael Dennison
**Little Dorrit'' – Barbara Kidd
|}
Commercial
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!Excellence in Commercial Design
|-
| valign="top"|
*Milk, "Milkquarious" – Casey Storm
|}
Special Awards
Career Achievement Award
* Sandy Powell
* Michael Travis
Swarovski Award
* Emily Blunt
Distinguished Collaborator Award
* Rob Marshall
Hall of Fame
* Robert Turturice
